text:
Raskolnikov turned, confused. 

“Who are you?” he asked. 

“I have sinned,” the man whispered. 

“How?” 

“By evil thoughts.” 

They stared at each other. 

Raskolnikov felt a chill. 

“Did you tell Porfiry I was there?” he demanded. 

“Who’s Porfiry?” 

“The detective!” 

“Yes, I went there just before you.” 

“What did you hear?” 

“I saw the porters hesitate. They didn’t want to come.” 

“Why?” 

“They feared you’d be angry.” 

Raskolnikov’s heart raced. 

“Then you were the surprise?” 

“Yes, I was.” 

Raskolnikov grasped the gravity. 

What now?

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with the psychological implications of his actions and the potential consequences of being discovered.
